page.title: 14Interview at Hill Farm
page.content: We visited Hill Farm which is situated at the top of a steep hill.Mr Botteril the farmer,told us that he had lived there for 57 years.He has 54 acres of land,devoted entirely to sown and fertilised grassland that is used for grazing or cut for hay or for sileage. He has 54 Friesian milking cows and they produce 4 litres each per day on average.A tanker picks the milk up at 9am.The herd is a'flying herd' meaning that the farmer does not breed his own cattle but sells them for beef and then buys fresh stock.His fields yield 5,000 bales of hay per year and this is stored in two barns for use as fodder.His latest venture is to rear a special breed of cattle that produce lean beef.He also has 1,000 battery hens producing at least one egg each per day.He has 13 different types of machinery to help with harvesting etc.
